intro: Cephaloxys graminifolia, commonly known as the grassy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal leaves that are grass-like in appearance, hence its common name, and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Cephaloxys graminifolia is often found in regions with mild climates and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
